FBlock.FBlockDescription: The NetBlock provides functions that affect a whole device. Each device has to contain the function block NetBlock.

Function.FunctionDescription: Property for inquiring the function blocks that are implemeted in a device and for setting the InstID.
Inquire the node position address of the device with this property.
With this property the logical node address of the devices can be set or inquired.
With this property the group address of the devices can be set or inquired.
Activate or deactivate the device's ability to wake up the network. This function decides if a device has permission to WakeUp. Operation SetGet shall not be used, use Set instead.

PEParam.ParamDescription: Permission to wake up the network.

Function.FunctionDescription: In normal operation mode only the Power Master switches off the network.
With this property the retry time of the devices can be set or inquired.
Inquire the sampling frequency of the MOST Network. This property is provided only in that device, which contains the timing master. A slave device reports an error message "function not available".
State information before last restart of the network.

PUParam.ParamDescription: The diagnostic identifier of the device. The content is defined by the system integrator and its length has to be chosen so that the message can be sent as an unsegmented control message.

Function.FunctionDescription: Provides a static list with all implemented FBlocks.
Provides an IEEE defined 48-bit extended unique identifier.

PQParam.ParamDescription: (Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Messages: OPType")

Function.FunctionDescription: This function has to be implemented in every node. It describes the version of the FBlock, divided into the major version, the minor version and the build number. (E.g., Version 2.3.5)

PUParam.ParamDescription: Major version value of the FBlock.
Minor version value of the FBlock.

Function.FunctionDescription: The function SourceHandles is able to determine which function block in a device holds a particular connection at the moment. If an inquiry carries the Handle = 0xFF, all respective function blocks for each connection will be returned.

StreamCase.PosDescription: Handle, FBlockID, InstID {, Handle, FBlockID, InstID}

Function.FunctionDescription: This property administrates the Notification Matrix of a function block.

Under certain system conditions it can be helpfull if a device can check whether its entries are still existent in the notification matrix or not. In case of error, a device is able to renew its entries.
Provides the result of the RBD test containing the status of the test and its diagnostic identifier.

Property for administration of the boundary between streaming data and packet data. This property is available only in the TimingMaster device, and therefore only accessible in the NetBlock with instance ID 0.

PNParam.ParamDescription: Boundary between streaming data and packet data in quadlets.
(Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Protocols: OPType")
(Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Protocols: OPType")

FBlock.FBlockDescription: In a MOST network there exists exactly one Network Master. The Network Master administrates the central registry that represents an image of the physical and logical system configuration.

Function.FunctionDescription: With the property FktIDs the functions of a function block may be inquired.
This function has to be implemented in every node. It describes the version of the FBlock, divided into the major version, the minor version and the build number. (E.g., Version 2.3.5)

PUParam.ParamDescription: Major version value of the FBlock.
Minor version value of the FBlock.

Function.FunctionDescription: Informs each device about the state of the network configuration. If this correspond to the previous operation, the devices may hold their decentral registries. The Status is reported by a broadcast message.

StreamParam.ParamDescription: Functional address of an FBlock.
Distinction of identical FBlocks in a system.

StreamCase.PosDescription: Stream structure: {RxTxLog1, FBlockID1, InstID1} {, RxTxLog2, FBlockID2, InstID2} ...

StreamParam.ParamDescription: Calculated by each device when the network is initialized: RxTxLog = 0x0100 + RxTxPos.
Functional address of an FBlock.
Distinction of identical FBlocks in a system.

Function.FunctionDescription: Inquiry of informations about a function block out of the central registry. The parameter InstID is optional. After a Get without any parameter the network master reponds with all registry entries.

StreamCase.PosDescription: RxTxLog, FBlockID, InstID {, RxTxLog, FBlockID, InstID}

Function.FunctionDescription: Function for saving the central registry as default configuration.
Property for administration of the boundary between synchronous and asynchronous area in the network master.

After System State OK is entered the NetworkMaster shall query the property ImplFBlockIDs of each device that either reported an empty or non empty list as FBlockIDs.Status before. Furthermore, the NetworkMaster shall also query the property ImplFBlockIDs after it has received an FBlockIDs.Status message from a device that has not replied to ImplFBlockIDs.Get at all or has replied with ImplFBlockIDs.Error 0x41 before. A system integrator may decide to delay that request according to the specific needs. By comparing the list of implemented FBlocks with the list of registered FBlocks in the Central Registry, the NetworkMaster can determine the current state of the system configuration and makes this information available via the function SystemAvail. This function is optional.

PUParam.ParamDescription: (Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Messages: OPType")

Function.FunctionDescription: With the property FktIDs the functions of a function block may be inquired.
This property administrates the Notification Matrix of a function block.
This method instructs the connection master to build a synchronous connection between sink and source.

MUParam.ParamDescription: Number of data sink within the sink FunctionBlock. 0x01 for the first sink.
Instance ID of the Synchronous data sink
Function Block ID of the Synchronous data sink
Number of data source within the Source FBlock. 0x01 for the first source.
Instance ID of the Synchronous data source
FBlock ID of the Synchronous data source

Function.FunctionDescription: This method instructs the connection master to remove the synchronous connection between the specified sink and source.

MUParam.ParamDescription: Number of data sink within the sink FBlock. 0x01 for the first sink.
Instance ID of the Synchronous data sink
FBlock ID of the Synchronous data sink
Number of data source within the Source FBlock. 0x01 for the first source.
Instance ID of the Synchronous data source
FBlock ID of the Synchronous data source

Function.FunctionDescription: Array of all existing connections including sources and sinks.

StreamCase.PosDescription: SourceFBlock, SourceInstID, SourceNr, SinkFBlock, SinkInstID, SinkNr, SrcDelay, NoChannels, ChannelList {, SourceFBlock, SourceInstID, SourceNr, SinkFBlock, SinkInstID, SinkNr, SrcDelay, NoChannels, ChannelList}

StreamParam.ParamDescription: FBlock ID of the Synchronous data source
Instance ID of the Synchronous data source
Number of data source within the Source FBlock. 0x01 for the first source.
FBlock ID of the Synchronous data sink.
Instance ID of the Synchronous data sink
Number of data sink within the sink FBlock. 0x01 for the first sink.
Delay of synchronous data related to the Timing Master.
Number of channels given in the parameter channels
Channel numbers of the synchronous connection
Number of a channel.

Function.FunctionDescription: This property reflects the number of synchronous channels that are currently available for connection requests.
The ConnectionMaster generates an array of all existing connections, including sources and sinks, where it adds more information. This array is accessible in the property ConnectionTable.

StreamCase.PosDescription: Stream structure: {SourceFBlock1, SourceInstID1, SourceNr1, SinkFBlock1, SinkInstID1, SinkNr1, BlockWidth1, ConnectionLabel1} {, SourceFBlock2, SourceInstID2, SourceNr2, SinkFBlock2, SinkInstID2, SinkNr2, BlockWidth2, ConnectionLabel2}...

StreamParam.ParamDescription: FBlock ID of the streaming data source.
Instance ID of the streaming data source
Number of a data source within the Source FBlock. 0x01 is used for the first source.
FBlock ID of the streaming data sink.
Instance ID of the streaming data sink.
Number of a data sink within the sink FBlock. 0x01 is used for the first sink.
Number of transferred bytes per MOST frame.
Connection identifier.

PCParam.ParamDescription: (Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Messages: OPType")
(Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Messages: OPType")

Function.FunctionDescription: This property is used for transferring diagnostic messages. The Set OpType is used for transferring a diagnostic request and the Status OpType is used for transferring a diagnostic response. For this FktID implicit notification exists, that is, the controller will receive an OpType Status reply to requests with OpType Set. The usual notification mechanism, where Notification.Set is used, is not applied.

PUParam.ParamDescription: The Payload data field of the DAP PDU.
Determines the length of the Payload parameter.
The data field SourceAddress can be used to identify the test tool that has sent a request.
This field identifies the version of the DAP header
(Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Messages: OPType")
(Refer to the MOST Specification, section "Structure of MOST Messages: OPType")

ErrorDef.ErrorDefInfo: 0x01 Buffer overflow; 0x02 List overflow; 0x03 Element overflow; 0x04 Value not available
